com.googlecode.jlynx
Interface DAO

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
DAOImpl
public interface DAO
extends java.io.Serializable

This interface defines methods to persist and retrieve POJOs from relational databases systems (RDBMS), and to fetch results as Java objects. The API currently has been tested on the following databases:

  • IBM DB2/UDB
  • Microsoft SQL Server 2000
  • Oracle 9i,10g
  • MySQL
  • HSQL
  • PostGreSQL

Requires Java 1.5 or higher as of Version 1.7

$Id: DAO.java 529 2010-12-18 19:21:30Z gregrmi $

Since:
v1.0

save

int save()
         throws java.sql.SQLException
Saves POJO to database; equivalent to update() if record exists or insert() if record does not exist. POJO is then updated with current database values.

Returns:
int
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

saveNulls

void saveNulls(boolean keepNullsInQuery)
Whether null should be preserved in UPDATE and INSERT statements; by default NULL property values are removed from the statement. Empty Strings are treated as NULLs if set to true.

Parameters:
keepNullsInQuery - true (nulls are preserved) or false (default - nulls removed from SQL queries)
Since:
v1.0
